storyInfo: Meteorite studies language with a Sarkaz teacher in the midst of war, but encounters unexpected difficulties due to her personal experiences.

attributes.content: Birch, linden, fir, pine...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Child

attributes.content: Rose, daisy, orchid, tulip...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Child

attributes.content: Sunset, dusk, twilight, night...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Child

attributes.content: Got all that down? Now let's try reading an entire passage.
attributes.name: Meteorite

attributes.content: Okay.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Child

attributes.content: 'The roses in the garden have bloomed, filling the garden with a sweet scent.'
attributes.name: Sarkaz Child

attributes.content: 'I look up at the sky, at the sunset in the distance.'
attributes.name: Sarkaz Child

attributes.content: 'It is a... a...'
attributes.name: Sarkaz Child

attributes.content: What's the matter? Is something wrong?
attributes.name: Meteorite

attributes.content: I don't know this word, Miss Meteorite.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Child
Meteorite
attributes.content: Let me see...

attributes.name: Meteorite
attributes.content: Ah, sorry, I must've forgotten to mark it yesterday.
attributes.joined: Let me see...Ah, sorry, I must've forgotten to mark it yesterday.

attributes.content: Okay, repeat after me:
attributes.name: Meteorite

attributes.content: (Speaks in Sarkaz)
attributes.name: Meteorite

attributes.content: (Repeats after Meteorite)
attributes.name: Sarkaz Child

attributes.content: Very good.
attributes.name: Meteorite

attributes.content: What does it mean?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Child

attributes.content: It's a word that describes a very specific scene, one that is...
attributes.name: Meteorite

attributes.content: Keep moving! Why are you standing in the middle of the road?!
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Shit, another damned beggar.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: A beggar? Here?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Don't poke your head out. It might get his attention.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: Dammit, he's coming this way.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: So what? Just ignore him.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Sir? Ma'am? Anybody need someone to write a letter for them? I'm only asking for a few coins, or some food.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Passerby

attributes.content: Hey, Salley, you need this beggar to write a letter for you?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: Gimme a break, what's the point if I can't even read?!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary B

attributes.content: Haha, even better! He can read for you, too. Two jobs for one beggar.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: Get lost.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary B

attributes.content: You hear that, bum? Scram. We've got no money and no need for any letters. Everyone I know who ain't dead is right here in this group.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: Sir! Wait, sir!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Passerby

attributes.content: Sir, please, even just a cup of water!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Passerby

attributes.content: *Sigh*... Over here!
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Do you need a letter written, young lady?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Passerby

attributes.content: Not interested. But you can have this bread. This is a battlefield, and we don't need what you're selling.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: (Stomach growls)
attributes.name: Sarkaz Passerby

attributes.content: I'm not a beggar. I can't just take something for free.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Passerby

attributes.content: Do you want to learn to read and write yourself? Those soldiers don't understand the value of words, and they're too old and stuck in their ways. But you're young. It'll be useful to you.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Passerby

attributes.content: I don't have time for that. We have to keep moving.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: I can come with your group, then. If you decide to study with me, I promise I won't leave until you've gotten the hang of it.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Passerby

attributes.content: I see... Here, you can have your bread back.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Passerby

attributes.content: Just keep it and eat up, quick. We still have a long way to go. You can teach me on the way.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Ah, alright.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Passerby

attributes.content: Do you know how to write your name? I can teach you that first.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Passerby

attributes.content: We don't have names, only codenames.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: What's your codename then?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Passerby

attributes.content: Blunt Wedge. One of the previous captains named me.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: It's a nice name.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Passerby

attributes.content: Yeah right. The captain told me it means 'useless arrow'.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Haha. There's a Sarkaz proverb: 'Beware rusty arrows.' Infection is no joke.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Passerby

attributes.content: Heh... So what were you doing before the war started?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: I was a teacher.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Passerby

attributes.content: Two months later...
I wonder how long this war will go on.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: (Wraps wounds)
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: How's your injury?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: It's fine. I disinfected it and wrapped it with bandages. It should heal up soon.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: That's good. What a beautiful day... The sunlight's so warm.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: I've almost finished that book that you lent me. Got any others?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Only poems and essays.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Never mind then.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Hey, Blunt Wedge, you got that wound wrapped up?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Yeah, it's fine, I applied the dressings.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: The what now? Whatever, come get your share.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10... 14 heads total. Not bad! Could've made more if we didn't let a few get away.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: (Frowns)
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Your share of the bounty, plus rations. Okay, later.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Wait, that's not enough.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: What're you talking about?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: I killed two snipers and an armored grenadier.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Those are 30 and 50 percent more than standard, per our agreement. So that's 12 gold coins short.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Since when did you learn crunch numbers like that?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: (Hold out hand) 12 gold coins, or we could sort this out with the captain. And I might mention your little cache while we're at it.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: What are getting at?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: No need to play dumb. Your side gig is none of my business, as long as you don't try to screw me over.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: ...Take your money and keep your mouth shut.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: (Shrugs)
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Haha, you're a quick learner. Not quite what I had in mind for applied math, but it does the job.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: It's just that everything you teach is way too easy.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Well, looks like you've learned everything from me you need to. It's time for me to go.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Here.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Half a sack of gold coins? For me?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Lesson fees for two months.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Well, I'm not going to say no.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Where are you going to go after this?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: I heard things are calmer in the east. Maybe there are still a few schools remaining there.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: You know how to use a weapon. You could've made a living as a mercenary. Why insist on making it hard on yourself?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Kazdel won't miss a single sellsword.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Tch... you intellectual types.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: So when will you finish the book? Remember to return it before I leave.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Tomorrow. I'm almost at the end.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: 'Mathilda found the moonlight shining through the windows too bright. She rubbed her eyes and closed the curtains, before falling into slumber in the... er...'
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: What does this word mean? I've never seen it before... let's keep going.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: 'Sitting by the campfire with her friends, Mathilda poked at the chestnuts in the fire. The sweet scent in the... er... was a gift.'
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: That word again? Gah.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: 'Mathilda closed the door, picked up her suitcase, and prepared to get in the car. She thought back to the countless... er... that she spent here...'
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Countless what?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: 'Farewell, those... er...'
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Who are you saying goodbye to, Mathilda?!
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: 'Perhaps in the days to come, she will see more... er..., but there will be no... er... as unforgettable as the... er... here.'
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: How many freaking times does it need to appear in one sentence?!
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: What the heck does it even mean?!
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: That took longer than expected. How was it? You could keep it as little farewell gift, if you like.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Nah, I prefer adventure novels to reading about some girl sitting on a farm. Honestly, it was pretty frustrating to read.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Was there a problem?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Yeah, there was a word in there I'd never seen. I tried to skip it, but it kept showing up, way too often.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Let me see... ah.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: It means a pleasant and serene night.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: ...A what?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Well, a night that's happy.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: That doesn't make any sense. Nights aren't happy or serene.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Why not?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Because they're long, dark, and cold. They're dangerous and you have to always stay on guard... I hate the night.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: I've spent so many nights thinking I would die right there and become food for nocturnal scavengers, never to see the sunrise again.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: You could understand 'nocturnal scavengers', but not 'a pleasant and serene night'?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: I mean, I've seen plenty of animals tearing at dead bodies. I could picture it as soon as you explained it.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Well, in that case, let's try picturing it together. Close your eyes.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Gotcha.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Think back to when you were a little girl, sitting by your mother's side one night...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Stop right there. I've never met my mother.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Well... did you have any other parental figure as you grew up?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: The previous captain found me on the battlefield and raised me.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Well, picture sitting by her side then. How do you feel?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: I'm sitting next to her, and she...
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: She pushes me away, tells me the warband has no use for a weak child, and makes me run ten laps around the camp holding a bucket of water in each hand, without spilling a drop.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: My shoulders are starting to get sore.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: A-Alright, let's try something else. You and your friends are sitting by a campfire in the forest. There's a delicious-smelling pot of soup on the fire.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: What do you feel?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: I stick my nose out to get a whiff of it...
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Exactly!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Then I turn around and see a hand reaching for my pack, trying to steal my money pouch. Why the heck did the captain even let that known thief in?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: So I feel really pissed and kinda wish he was right here so I could punch him.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: ...Never mind, let's start over.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Alright... it's nighttime. Gentle moonlight sweeps across the land. You wrap your blanket around you and feel your eyelids dropping, dragging you into slumber.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: What do you feel?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Fear.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Artillery fire might rain down on the camp at any moment... I hide under the bed, covering my ears with my friends.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: *Sigh*... Look at what war has done to you children.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Sorry for not getting it.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: It's okay. Let me think of another way.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: It's just a word. You don't need to go that far to teach me.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Every year, many new things appear in our lives, and new words are created to describe them.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Most of these words are forgotten as the things they describe disappear, never to be uttered again.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: But some words are special. They're passed down from one person to another, living on in our collective memory.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: That's because they describe something eternal and unchanging. They represent the most precious, foundational spirit of their people.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: They're worth understanding and remembering.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: So... what if I just can't understand it?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Patience, young lady. Give it time to take root.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Look out for the dried branches under your feet. They're overgrown with moss and very slippery after a rain.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Alright. You're talking too much.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Now can you tell me why you woke me up in the middle of the goddamn night?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: You really are grumpy in the morning.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Pardon me, sir, would you care to enlighten me as to why you've brought me to this place?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: (Puts a piece of cloth on the ground)
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Sit.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: (Sits down on the cloth, confused)
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Here you go.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: ...Canned peaches?!
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: I knew you'd like them. I saw the way you were staring when your captain had a can a few days ago.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Hmph, they're not that special. ...So how'd you get your hands on 'em?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: I traded a book for two cans, with your captain.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Whoa, that's one valuable book. What was it?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Just an old manuscript. It wasn't doing anyone any good.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Give me a break, I know how the captain has been collecting old books and selling them to the Columbians.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: I'm just stating the facts.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: ...There's still half a can left. Want it?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: All yours.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Thanks...
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: What do you feel when you look around you?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: *Slap*
(Looks at her palm in disgust)
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Too many bugs.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: There's no need to kill them, they don't bite... but never mind that.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: I spent a few nights looking for them. I brought you here because they're special.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: I can see their backsides glowing.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Huh... I've seen these by the water before, but I didn't know they were bugs. I thought...
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Thought what?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: I thought they were the ghosts of people killed in battle.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: People do associate them with will-o-wisps found near graves, but they glow in different ways.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Will-o-wisps are caused by gases released by decomposing bodies, which have a very low flash point and ignite when they come into contact with air.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: What about these bugs, then?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: They secrete chemicals that glow, using their respiration to control the biochemical reaction in order to adjust the brightness.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Their abdomens contain a large amount of light-emitting chemicals and cells.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: A bug lands on the man's palm, its backside glowing with a blue light.
Soon, more of the insects draw near, until his entire hand is surrounded in light.
The man seems able to speak endlessly about them, using many complicated words that Blunt Wedge does not understand.
She does not feel troubled, however. In fact, what she's feeling is unfamiliar to her.
It's like a little bug is flapping its wings in her heart, slowly ascending, with a light on its butt that is weak and dim, but filled with vitality.
I think I feel something.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: They like to lay their eggs by the water... Wait, what do you feel? Tell me!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: I feel...
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: The sound of an explosion interrupts her.
The bugs scatter at the noise, their lights disappearing into the dark woods.
A plume of smoke can be seen in the distance, covering the few stars visible in the night sky.
Oh shit! It's coming from the camp!
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Wait, Blunt Wedge! You haven't told me how you felt yet.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: There's no time for that. We need to get back.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: It's important to me. Please, I must know.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Say something, please.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Nothing.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: I felt nothing.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: I'm sorry, they flew away too fast. I couldn't catch them.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: No, you felt something! I could see it on your face!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: (Shakes head frantically)
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Why were you crying if you didn't feel anything?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: (Wipes away the tears roughly)
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Maybe there was nowhere in my heart for it to take root.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Where were you, Blunt Wedge? The captain was asking about you.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: I went into the forest.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: In the middle of the night? Why?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: She went on patrol because she was concerned about the enemies that got away a few days ago.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Y-Yeah, I thought they might retaliate.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Well, you were right. They attacked the camp. The night watch was asleep on duty and got his throat slit.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Wasn't Salley on duty?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Yup, he's dead.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: We lost a bunch of supplies in the fire, too. Can't believe we're going hungry after months of hard work... dammit.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Anyone injured?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: A few guys got burned. But we lost a lot of medical supplies too, so here's hoping they make it.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Alright, I gotta go. You should find the captain before he gets mad.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Okay...
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: You really should go, Blunt Wedge.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Are you... okay?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: You're the one who just had something bad happen to you. Why are you asking me?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: You look so sad...
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Don't worry, it's not because of you.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Why, then?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Because of the scorched earth, where nothing will grow again.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: It's getting late. I should go.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: There's no need to see me off. I'll be fine on my own.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Just a little further. We might not see each other again.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: I wanted to thank you... You taught me so many useful things. As for that word...
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: I couldn't understand it, but maybe someone else would.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: It's okay. No need to bring it up.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: ...Sorry.
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Don't apologize. It's not your fault. Never was.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: I've seen many children like you, who've lost their homes, are used to seeing blood and killing, and drift from one battlefield to the next.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: You were the only one who stopped to peruse the knowledge I was peddling.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: For so many years, I believed that knowledge and culture could bring about change, overcome war and violence.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: But in the end, it looks like war has won. It's made a mockery of everything I knew.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Are you giving up? If you won't teach people the true meaning of those words, who else can?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Won't they disappear from our lives with no one to understand and preserve them?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: All it means is that the beauty those words represented was fleeting. Only pain and suffering remains.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: I'm powerless to fight it.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: It's all good. Don't cry.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Take this book. I've travelled across Kazdel compiling the vocabulary of the land, trying to complete it.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: A dictionary of the Sarkaz language?
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: I haven't written that word down yet. Do it for me, if you ever find help understanding it in the future.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: Alright...
attributes.name: Blunt Wedge

attributes.content: Wipe away your tears. This is goodbye.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Teacher

attributes.content: ...teorite? Miss Meteorite?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Child

attributes.content: Oh!
attributes.name: Meteorite

attributes.content: Ah, yes, it means a night that is pleasant and serene.
attributes.name: Meteorite

attributes.content: Oh, I get it now! Thank you!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Child

attributes.content: (Pats the child on the head)
attributes.name: Meteorite

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Child

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Meteorite

attributes.content: Why are you crying?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Child

attributes.content: Because you're a very smart kid.
attributes.name: Meteorite
